subject: RE: [junit] (3.8) ComparisonFailure output format choice
msgSnippet: I don t understand this. Doesn t that message include the exact character position at which the two strings stop matching? How much more context do you want?
messageBody:
I don't understand this. Doesn't that message include the exact character
position at which the two strings stop matching? How much more context do
you want? :) Also, it's supposed to show 20 characters to the left of the
mismatch and 60 to the right. If it does not, then that is definitely not
Alex's original patch.

As far as I know, there is no way to change this behavior without changing
the framework source.

Original Message:
-----------------
From: louis_strous louis_strous@...
Date: Mon, 27 Jan 2003 15:23:56 -0000
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] (3.8) ComparisonFailure output format choice


Is there an option in junit 3.8.1 to get context from getMessage in
junit.framework.ComparisonFailure, more similar to the pre-3.8
situation? I haven't found one. I don't at all like the new
output format, with "..." replacing initial and final parts of the
text that are equal between the "expected" and "found" values.
There's no context at all! This makes it take more time or effort to
identify the offending input text, and the offending characters within
the offending text. What if the test complains about <...X...> and I
have 20 Xes in my text?
<snip />
